---
title: "session_domain_scheme_port.yml"
---

## High-level description
This YAML configuration file defines authentication settings for a system. It specifies that authentication is required and sets up session parameters along with enabled authentication methods.

## Symbols

### `authentication`
#### Description
The root configuration object for authentication settings.

#### Internal Logic
- Sets authentication as required
- Configures session parameters
- Specifies enabled authentication methods

### `authentication.required`
#### Description
A boolean flag indicating whether authentication is mandatory for the system.

#### Outputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| required | boolean | Set to `true`, indicating that authentication is required |

### `authentication.session`
#### Description
Configures session-related parameters for authentication.

#### Internal Logic
- Specifies the domain for the session
- Sets the secure flag for the session

### `authentication.session.domain`
#### Description
Defines the domain where the session is valid.

#### Outputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| domain | string | Set to "http://localhost:8080", indicating a local development environment |

### `authentication.session.secure`
#### Description
A boolean flag indicating whether the session should be transmitted securely.

#### Outputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| secure | boolean | Set to `false`, allowing non-secure transmission (likely for development purposes) |

### `authentication.methods`
#### Description
Specifies the enabled authentication methods.

#### Internal Logic
- Configures token-based authentication
- Configures OpenID Connect (OIDC) authentication

### `authentication.methods.token`
#### Description
Configures token-based authentication.

#### Outputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| enabled | boolean | Set to `true`, indicating that token-based authentication is enabled |

### `authentication.methods.oidc`
#### Description
Configures OpenID Connect (OIDC) authentication.

#### Outputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| enabled | boolean | Set to `true`, indicating that OIDC authentication is enabled |

## Configuration
| Option | Type | Default | Description |
|:-------|:-----|:--------|:------------|
| authentication.required | boolean | true | Specifies if authentication is mandatory |
| authentication.session.domain | string | "http://localhost:8080" | Defines the session domain |
| authentication.session.secure | boolean | false | Indicates if the session should be secure |
| authentication.methods.token.enabled | boolean | true | Enables token-based authentication |
| authentication.methods.oidc.enabled | boolean | true | Enables OIDC authentication |

This configuration file appears to be a test data file (`testdata`) for an authentication setup, likely used in a development or testing environment. It sets up a non-secure session on localhost with both token and OIDC authentication methods enabled.
